lines.text: McDonnells!
[Sounds like McDonald's]
Hungry, Pop?
Um, yeah.
[repeated line]
I'm happy.
You sold the shoe store? You sold the shoe store?
I'm sorry, Pop, I just couldn't find the right way to tell you.
Tell me what?
That I sold the shoe store.
You sold the shoe store?
The neighborhood was changing and it wasn't worth anything!

[Showing him a deed]
It's worth half a million dollars. See? McDonnell's!

[Thinking he said 'McDonalds']
You hungry again, Pop?
Yeah.
Don't worry, Lenny, the hook will catch the wire.
Who are you here to see?
Arlene Setters.
Ah yes, the bitch. 907.
Hey, one-nut! Wanna beer?
You're not gonna kill yourself. I'll kill you if you kill yourself.
[Sara the dog barks, startling Harry]
I'll put'im in the closet.
Sara wouldn't like that.
I meant Harry.
The mafia!

[Harry fires a gun, scaring off two mobsters]
The mafia.
Nuh-uh.
[in a hospital]
You let your patients smoke in here?
Honey, they all gonna die of something sooner or later.
My parents stay here too. They ain't never gonna die. It's the air conditioning. It's like they're in cold storage.
I wanna tell you something, Pop, I missed you.
You know I have to tell you something too. I don't know who the hell you are.
Sure you do.
No, I don't.
Still a kidder, aren't you Dad? It's me, Jon!
Jon? Jon! My boy!
This morning he named every member of his fighter squad like it was yesterday.
1943 he remembers like it was yesterday. It's yesterday he can't remember like it was yesterday.
I remember this picture.
Oh yeah. Guy on the left had is Tom Hankerman, he flew 37 missions before going down over Okinawa.
Pop, you're putting your shorts on backwards.
Huh? Oh yeah. That guy there is Lenny Coleman. Lenny ran that little airfield I flew out of after the war.
Is that the place you took me to for my first ride?
Your mother too. And last ride for her!
Pop, you see much of Arlene?
Arlene?
Your loving daughter.
No.
Oh, Pop.
[after being rescued by an accident in which Jon let his father drive the car]
How'd you say this happened?
My father accidentally put the car in the wrong gear and then he accidentally got his foot stuck on the accelerator.
I'm 35 years old, Jon!
You're not 35 years old, I'm 40 and you're older than I am!
I'm 35! I'm got two obnoxious teenage boys and no husband. I have to compete with firm young women and there's only so much plastic surgery can do for me.
I'd have blown Hitler to get out of that house.
We're so disappointed, no one would kill us.
[after an accident, John hads one of his testicles removed]
Thanks, Pop, I got one nut. Thank you very much!
You're welcome.
I'm perfect if anybody wants a one-balled, deaf, blind, unemployed vagrant with a limp.
This whole experience must really be trying.
Yes, I feel horrible.
I meant for them.
Oh yeah, them too.

[about his Cadillac]
This baby can go! I told your mother how much it cost and she shit a cat! If only she knew how much it really set me back.
You work too hard, Ed. Get a girl.
Look, this is tough on me too.
Well gee, I feel sorry for you, you back-stabbing pig!

[to Jon]
Hey, laughing boy, you didn't pay your bill. But then again you ain't the sharpest knife in the drawer!
What happened to your clothes?
The mob stole'em.
Hey, ball sac, they're towing your car! What am I supposed to drive?
Hi, Uncle Jon.
Jon! My dear little brother, we missed you. So I just thought me and the boys would come up and stay for a while with you and your lovely family.
Let's cut the bullshit. We need a place to live, she ran out of alimony.
And the asshole with the boat ran out on her.
What about your sister?
The bitch?
STOP THE CAR!
Do you mind? We're trying to finish the game while we're still alive.
[Steve and Jerry, Arlene's sons, come running in]
Look who's here, Uncle Jon.
The asshole from Chicago?
That's him.

[Is smashing a wire he was told to wear]
This is special agent Jon Aldrich reporting.
[Smashes microphone]
This is Jon Aldrich to J. Edgar, come in, big guy.
[Smashes]
Hello, Ed, can you hear me?
[Smashes]
That's it, Arlene, I am retiring as executioner!
You're so much nicer than Jon's first wife.
You were married before?
Um...
You were married before and you didn't tell me?
Didn't I tell you? I thought I told you. I told somebody. Ha ha.
Lucky those cops saw you. There wasn't any time to waste, I felt we should operate.
Operate?
Lot's of men only have one testicle.
Did you say I have only one testicle?
That's right.
Nope, nope.
[Looks under sheet]
Oh no!
Don't be upset, one is all you need. The other is just sort of a back up. It won't affect your sex life.

[Harry has walked in on Jon and Audrey having sex]
Jon, how long do you think he was watching?
I didn't see anything.
This is a *Good* shoe!

[as the manager is about to strike Jon, Harry hits him over the head with a shoe]
I told you you're fired!
